outputs.output_descr:
The overall goal of the Joint Programme is to improve the quality of HIV prevention services and increase the coverage of these services towards universal access in sites with the highest number of new HIV infections, thereby contributing to the UNDAF Sub-outcome on HIV and AIDS: "By 2018, more people at-most-risk, living with and affected by HIV have access to quality HIV prevention, treatment, care and support services."  

The three components of the Joint Programme, i.e. policy reform, capacity-building, and governance, are interlinked.  Each component is described brieflyin the joint programme, together with a list of indicative activities.  These are intended to serve as frameworks, recognizing that local-level activities may vary depending on the local needs and context.

The UN Joint Programme on Most-at-Risk Populations will be implemented in areas which register the highest number of new HIV infections: Metro Manila (Cities of Quezon, Makati, Manila and Pasay), Metro Cebu (Cities of Cebu, Mandaue and Lapu-lapu) and Davao City.  It will address the key barriers to the country's achieving its MDG and universal access targets.  The Joint Programme will contribute to the goals of the 5th AIDS Medium Term Plan.

The overall goal of the Joint Programme is to improve the quality of HIV prevention services and increase the coverage of these services towards universal access in sites with the highest number of new HIV infections, thereby contributing to the UNDAF Sub-outcome on HIV and AIDS: "By 2018, more people at-most-risk, living with and affected by HIV have access to quality HIV prevention, treatment, care and support services."

project_descr: Joint UN Programme on HIV Prevention for Key Populations at Higher Risk (KPHR) in the Philippines
project_title: Joint UN Programme on Prevention among Most at Risk Popn
